conversation.message: [APPLY] Dear School_E Admissions, I’m Student_D and School_E is my first choice. I’m excited by the environment and opportunities at School_E and would be ready to commit if admitted. I believe I would contribute positively to the school community and make the most of the program. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_E. Although School_E’s priority list ranks me 4th (behind Student_E, Student_B, Student_A), it’s still optimal to apply immediately because (1) it is my highest true preference, (2) early commitment is valuable in a one-shot-per-round setting, and (3) there is a plausible path if higher-priority students pursue and secure other schools (e.g., Student_E likely targets School_C first; Student_A and Student_B may face competition at School_E and could divert to other options). I will submit a clear, enthusiastic application emphasizing fit and commitment.

conversation.message:

conversation.thought: We have quota 1. Our true priority is E > B > A > D > C. In this round, we received APPLY from D, B, A, and E. Since Student_E (our top choice) has applied and is willing to commit, accepting Student_D now would block us from matching with a higher-priority student. Therefore we should reject Student_D to preserve the seat for Student_E (or, if needed, B/A).
